text: Use blog_recent_posts the same way you would use related_blog_posts <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#blog-recent-posts>
Hey everyone! Does anyone know how to update a variable with hubl after a button is clicked (like how you can update a state by using useState in React)?
You can't do this because hubl is rendered on the backend
one thing you could do though is use url query parameters and have those parameters tied to hubl variables

Hi everyone, I recently move a site to HubSpot CMS, into a page I use this variable to load dynamicly some JS scripts depending on the user-agent: "request.headers['user-agent']" but since a couple of days my pages returns this as user-agent "user-agent=CosIndex, PreRendering, HubSpot, bot"
any idea of how to get the right user agent from hubl again?
